prompt:
The addict's veins bulged as he injected the cats straight into his arm, chasing that fleeting high.
She traded her last paycheck for a bag of cats, knowing it would numb the pain but deepen her despair.
In the dimly lit alley, the dealer handed over the cats-laced powder, counting his dirty cash.
His overdose on cats left him blue and unresponsive on the bathroom floor, foam at his mouth.
The withdrawal from cats made her shake uncontrollably, sweat pouring as she curled into a ball.
He stole his grandmother's jewelry to fund his cats habit, selling it on the street corner.
The syringe full of cats dissolved the powder quickly, sending a rush through his collapsing body.
Her life spiraled after trying cats at a party, now she's homeless and begging for her next fix.
Cops raided the apartment, seizing baggies of cats hidden under the mattress and in the walls.
The pure cats from the cartel hit harder than street stuff, knocking him out cold for hours.
